test_cases.name: Verify successful login and company selection with valid credentials
preconditions: A valid, active user account with sufficient permissions must exist.
The company specified in the test data must exist and be assigned to the login user.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Locate the email input field and enter the user's email address.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Wait for the password field to appear and enter the user's password.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is authenticated and redirected to the company selection page.

test_steps.action: Wait for the company selection page to load.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed with a list of companies associated with the user.

test_steps.action: Locate the specified company name and click on it to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: Upon selecting a company, the user is successfully navigated to the main application dashboard.

test_cases.name: Verify admin can successfully invite a new user and the user can complete onboarding
preconditions: The logged-in user must have administrator privileges.
The email address for the new user invitation must be unique and not already exist in the system.

test_steps.action: As an admin, navigate to the 'Administration' dropdown and click 'Manage Users'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Users' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the new user's email in the 'Email' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Set the 'Admin' checkbox according to the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Admin' checkbox state is set correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation is sent and a confirmation message is received, or the modal closes.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section and find the invited user's email.
test_steps.expected_result: The invited user appears correctly in the 'Pending Invitations' table.

test_steps.action: Click the tick/checkmark symbol in the Actions column for the invited user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form is displayed after clicking the accept action.

test_steps.action: On the 'Accept Invite' form, enter the user's 'First Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first name is entered into the 'First Name' field.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's 'Last Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The last name is entered into the 'Last Name' field.

test_steps.action: Enter and confirm the 'Create Password' for the new user.
test_steps.expected_result: A valid password is entered into the 'Create Password' field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Accept Invite' button to complete the account creation.
test_steps.expected_result: The new user account is created successfully, and the application navigates to the dashboard or a success page.

test_cases.name: Verify successful creation of a formula-based metric with a weekly cadence
preconditions: User is logged in and on the main application dashboard.
The metrics specified for the formula ('First_Metric', 'Second_Metric') must already exist in the system.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Metric Name' in the name input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The Formula Builder interface is displayed.

test_steps.action: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the 'First Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is successfully found and added to the formula.

test_steps.action: Click the specified 'Operator' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The operator is added to the formula.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the 'Second Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is successfully found and added to the formula.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is constructed and displayed as expected.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted.

test_steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Weekly'.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Resets On' field correctly appears only when 'Weekly' cadence is selected.

test_steps.action: Select the specified day from the 'Resets On' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The reset day is selected.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is saved successfully and a confirmation is received.

test_cases.name: Verify a newly created metric can be added to 'My KPIs' on the dashboard
preconditions: User is logged in and on the main application dashboard.
A metric has been created but has not yet been added to the user's 'My KPIs' section.

test_data.Metric_Name: Metric to be added to dashboard

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Locate the 'My KPIs' section and click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens and displays available and selected metrics.

test_steps.action: In the 'Edit KPI' modal, locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The newly created metric is found in the available metrics list.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric automatically moves to the right panel (selected KPIs).

test_steps.action: Verify the metric automatically moves to the right panel (selected KPIs).
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is now visible in the right panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes, the dashboard refreshes, and the new metric card is visible in the 'My KPIs' section.

test_cases.name: Verify successful configuration of a 'Custom' target with four performance levels for a dashboard metric
preconditions: User is logged in and on the 'My Dashboard' page.
The metric to be edited is already present in the 'My KPIs' section of the dashboard.

test_steps.action: On the 'My Dashboard' page, locate the correct metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric card is found.

test_steps.action: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu on the metric card opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the metric's Edit page.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, click the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Target' configuration section is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Custom' target input fields appear after selecting the 'Custom' radio button.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Level 1' target value.
test_steps.expected_result: The Level 1 value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Level 2' target value.
test_steps.expected_result: The Level 2 value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Level 3' target value.
test_steps.expected_result: The Level 3 value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Level 4' target value.
test_steps.expected_result: The Level 4 value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved without errors, the user is navigated back to the dashboard, and the metric card now displays visual indicators for the configured custom target.

test_cases.name: Verify successful configuration of a 'Time-Based' target with start and target values for a dashboard metric
preconditions: User is logged in and on the 'My Dashboard' page.
The metric to be edited is already present in the 'My KPIs' section of the dashboard.

test_steps.action: On the 'My Dashboard' page, locate the correct metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric card is found.

test_steps.action: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu on the metric card opens successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the metric's Edit page.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, click the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Target' configuration section is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Time-Based' target input fields for 'Start Value' and 'Target Value' appear.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Start Value' in its input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The Start value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Target Value' in its input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The Target value is entered successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved without errors, the user is navigated back to the dashboard, and the metric card now displays a progress indicator reflecting the configured time-based target.
